cyclone.name: JOSE
cyclone.current_location: about 925 miles east of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest, then turning northwest north of the Leeward Islands toward the open western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct landfall expected – core forecast to remain north of the Leeward Islands

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands northward toward the Bahamas and western Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Low (13%) chance of tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) gusts around late Saturday into Sunday; ≥50-kt winds very unlikely (3%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; core forecast to pass well north of the Virgin Islands.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain between 9–10 September.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and higher than normal surf beginning late Saturday and persisting through Sunday.
